text:
Mark Macias is a former Executive Producer with NBC, Senior Producer with CBS in New York and author of the book, Beat the Press: Your Guide to Managing the Media. He was a TV news anchor at WNEW-TV in New York and a reporter for WCBS-TV and WINS Radio in New York.
Maciasâ€™ first book, "Beat the Press: Your Guide to Managing the Media" was published by Simon & Schuster. It helps business leaders, politicians, celebrities and others learn how to effectively communicate their message through the media.

Macias graduated from Fordham University, where he earned a degree in Communications and Media Studies. 

He has also been an Adjunct Professor at New York University's School of Continuing Education, teaching classes on Public Relations, Crisis Communications, and Journalism.

## References

1. Macias, Mark. (2013). Beat the Press: Your Guide to Managing the Media. Gallery Books/Simon & Schuster.

2. Fordham University Alumni Magazine, Summer 2006.

3. "Former NBC, CBS producer pens guide to handling the press." The Buffalo News, June 10, 2007.

4. "Media Savvy: An Insider's Guide to Handling the Press" Washington Times, March 18, 2007.

5. "Journalist writes book on managing the media." The Hollywood Reporter, February 28, 2007.
